parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fall in, be cast in, be involved in. From en and pipto; to fall on, i.e. to be entrapped by, or be overwhelmed with.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A pit, ditch. Akin to bathuno; a hole; specially, a cistern.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

word: will he not take hold of
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
